intro: Sida triloba f. elongata, commonly known as the elongated thornapple, is a variant of the Sida triloba species, which belongs to the Malvaceae family. It is a herbaceous plant characterized by its hairy stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale pink flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Its fruit is a capsule that contains numerous small, dry seeds. This plant is often found in disturbed soils and is adapted to thrive in arid or semi-arid environments.
